reviews.review_text: Meticulous & enjoyably taxing // Recommended for deep-strategy fanatics

One of the best RTS games that i've ever played. Wargame: European Escalation is set in the cold war around the 1970's in a Nato vs Pact conflict. This game makes you think, such as what units you will need to use in battle. Sure, having a strong group of tanks is nice but you will also need anit-aircraft artillary in case of an oppenent launching an air attack. From what I have seen, there's always a counter unit to a unit. So basically if your oppenent does things right, he could destroy any of your units and you could destroy any of his. It all depends on the strategy you use. The single player has an interesting campaign and is challenging even on the easiest difficulty. There are not many people playing multiplayer, but you can find at least 1-2 matches a day. You are awarded command stars after completing tasks in mission or leveling up in muliplayer. Command stars allow you to purchase new vehicles for your armies. This will leave you playing for hours so you can unlock the tanks you want or a helicopter that looks cool. This game has a friendly community and I strongly recommend it to anyone interested in RTS games, or just strategy games in general.

Ok, so coming as a fan of the RTS genre I enjoyed the game. It was good, not great, but good. I liked that it required a certain degree of strategy aside from 'make more tanks, blow people away.' which is good. I disliked the fact that the AI doesnt really change up its beginning round movements at all so that if you replay something you know where everything is going to be from the start. Secondly, I HATE that the AI somehow knows all about my position and troop movements and has acts in turn to counter everything I try to do. In strategy games that is probably the biggest mistake a developer can make. That doesnt add challenge, it just pisses people off because they're not as clairvoyant as the AI. The player actually needs those scouts and recon units to see jack, while the AI somehow just knows these things and picks off your units making it frustrating to get good scores without playing level over and over. Overall, I would recommend the game, but only to those who already enjoy tough strategy games.

This game is meant for people who not only enjoy RTS but also enjoy extreme realism, if you are not a fan of either of these then wargame is not for you, that being said I myself loved this game it is not only an amazing RTS but also the most realistic RTS I have had the pleasure of playing and I would highly reccomend it.  10 out of 10 stars

I really enjoy this game, despite the sometimes insane difficulty. I've had a really hard time playing Warsaw Pact. The AI is merciless and relentless. The graphics work well for it and the game plays quite speedy on a modern PC. I've had no technical problems playing on Windows 10 x64 (or Windows 7 x64).  I'm an old school wargamer and this satisfies that enjoyment and has a modern feel being RTS. So, buy this if: You like semi-realistic RTS, modern warfare, a real challenge, an excellent set of single player campaigns. You may not like this if high-difficulty is off-putting or you are expecting more of a game-style RTS with base building and such.

All around super fun game with decent graphics and well thought through missions. I do highly reccomend getting this game if!  You like strategy.  You like a diverse selection of units.  You like an interesting campaign that actually kinda makes sense.  You like having total control of where your units go and what they shoot at.  You like large well detailed maps and missions.  You like somewhat realistic combat and strategy.  All around an awesome game that I highly recommend buying. Its realistic for the most part and has plenty of diverse maps and units. It has lots of details for each map and you can zoom in or out as much as needed. If you are into heavy strategy games then I think you should at least do some looking into on this game and see if its what you want. Hope this helps!

But lets get realistic here guys, they arn't just gunna walts right through Europe without a ♥♥♥♥in fight! Sadly, I really want to like this game, but I can't do so out of good heart. It looks fine, sounds fine, plays fine, controls fine, but I found it extremely hard and unfair. I play a lot of stragegy games and I like a good challange, but this game for me was very hard to play because you have little to no chance. Your units seem to be worse than the enemies' units, which would be fine, except they out number you about 10 to one. No matter how many units I call in, they always seem to have ten times as many units, and plus they have air support often when you don't, and captuing and holding an objective is hard enough, and gets even harder when you have to defend three points, while outnumbered, out gunned, and out maneuvered. I nveer got past level three or so, and I gave this game MANY tries, but I could never pull through, as misions can last for hours, with little to no progress made. As much as I want to like this game, I can't, and I have to recommend somehting like 'Men of War: Assault Squad 2' or 'Star Wars Empire at War' or 'World in Conflict' as opposed to this when suggesting a good RTS. Maybe I'm just REALLY bad at this, but I've played a LOT of RTS games, some of which can be very punishing (Men of War on veteran difficulty) and in those I still felt that I had a chance and could make progress and win, but in this I fight for hours and gain nothing but keep losing everything...
Somehow, the enemy player always fields the direct counter to whatever units you deploy.

While I appreciate the realism (persistent army between levels, level-up for survivors, fuel, ammo, logistics supply and command centers, lots of hide and seek), which is very nice and made me quite addicted for a while, I eventually quit playing for two basic reasons:  1. At the campaign, you have very limited troops and resources, while the CPU can spawn units forever as long as they have the reinforcements points. So you either rush or die. I don't appreciate STRATEGY when you have to rush. 2. Multiplayer, well ... you know how RTS multiplayer go, but in wargame it is worse because of the limited everything, so only the hardcore players will do anything, a casual player like me have no chance. 3. There are zillions of bugs on the border areas. For instance, enemy units that retreat (rout) outside the map cannot be easilly target, and worse yet, they might just stay there. I lost a couple of cames because some stupid enemy unit retreated near a reinforcement point and any/all supply truck I called in was immediatly captured, but since they spawn outside the map, I could not send troops to capture them back. Some enemy units go to far outside the map you can't even scout/see to try and siege them, wtf  So: campaign: you are infinitelly capped against an infinite oponent, so you have to win while you have troops; multiplayer: hardcore made even more hardcore. No, thanks.

Kind of a waste of money if you havent played Wargame before  I have never played a wargame before, but i wanted a fun, command and Conquer like game on the computer, so I got this. It seemed fun, and it seemed to have basic strategy elements to the game.   But, I would not recommend it simply because it is not noob-friendly. I spent 30 minutes trying to figure out how to play this game because there is no tutorial. It throws you into the game as if you are supposed to know what you are doing and what the controls are. And personally, I did not enjoy the 30 minutes I spent trying to learn basic controls, and I do not think most people would as well.

This just felt like a ruse clone, its not a bad game i just feel there are alot of other games on the market that do RTS alot better like company of heroes or the men of war series. If you have all those games then yeah, by all means pick this one up but i would rather spend my time playing a better game. Visuals are nice and has a great selection of cold war era weaponry, but in the end the gameplay gets abit boring, theres no excitement, the cover system for your infantry just doesnt feel right and i prob wont be installing it again as theres nothing here that which makes me want to return, sure theres unlockables like new units, choppers are fun to mess around with but after one play through i had had my fun and moved on to the next game and havnt been back since, thats strange for an RTS. People will disagree, but this is my honest opinion and like i said theres just better games out there so on that basis i cant really recommend it. Its not the worst RTS i have played but its def not the greatest, Overall 6/10
